Identification of suspicious external ac.Action: Analyze Zeek smtp.log for unusual patterns of email exchange volume between external recipients and internal users. Identify external domains with low reputation or recent registration dates. Use statistical analysis (e.g., entropy, correlation) on connection patterns in Zeek conn.log involving external IPs communicating with internal users or systems known to handle external interactions, looking for sudden spikes or unusual connection matrices.

Detection of phishing attempts originati.Action: Monitor Zeek smtp.log for inbound emails with characteristics of phishing (e.g., suspicious headers, bulk sending to multiple internal users, links to suspicious domains). Inner join Zeek smtp.log data with threat intelligence feeds for known malicious sending IPs or domains. Use linear regression or time series analysis to identify unusual increases in phishing attempts over time targeting specific individuals or groups.

Emails originating from domains/accounts.Action: Monitor Zeek smtp.log for inbound emails. Extract sender email addresses and domains. For sender domains, perform OSINT lookups to determine registration date and check reputation services (e.g., WHOIS, threat intelligence feeds). Flag emails from domains registered recently (e.g., < 30 days) or associated with low reputation scores. Analyze corresponding Zeek conn.log entries to identify source IPs and connection patterns. Use descriptive statistics on age and reputation scores of communicating domains to establish thresholds for flagging.

Increased volume or concentrated pattern.Action: Analyze Zeek smtp.log and Zeek conn.log for incoming traffic patterns targeting internal users or systems from external sources. Cluster external source IPs or sender domains based on timing, targeted internal users/systems, and content characteristics (for email). Identify clusters exhibiting high volume or correlated timing/targeting that may represent a coordinated campaign stemming from a small number of developed resources/personas. Use correlation analysis to identify relationships between external sources and internal targets and identify clusters of activity.
